item.title: patrycja add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Arthur Cleveland Coxe
item.description: "Tis the night—the night Of the grave's delight, And the warlocks are at their play; Ye think that without, The wild winds shout, But no, it is they—it is they!" -- Arthur Cleveland Coxe

item.title: patrycja add a quote by George Saunders
item.description: "Don't be afraid to be confused. Try to remain permanently confused. Anything is possible. Stay open, forever, so open it hurts, and then open up some more, until the day you die, world without end, amen." -- George Saunders

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Derek Walcott
item.description: "The time will come when, with elation, you will greet yourself arriving at your own door, in your own mirror, and each will smile at the other’s welcome." -- Derek Walcott

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Ryszard Kapuściński
item.description: "We do not really know what draws a human being out into the world. Is it curiosity? A hunger for experience? An addiction to wonderment? The man who ceases to be astonished is hollow, possessed of an extinguished heart. If he believes that everything has already happened, that he has seen it all, then something most precious has died within him—the delight in life." -- Ryszard Kapuściński

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Hal Borland
item.description: "No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn." -- Hal Borland

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Sue Grafton
item.description: "Ghosts don't haunt us. That's not how it works. They're present among us because we won't let go of them." -- Sue Grafton

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Lorraine Hansberry
item.description: "The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely." -- Lorraine Hansberry

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: patrycja add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes...you're Doing Something." -- Neil Gaiman
